utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, we’ve got power to the laser.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I should’ve brought an umbrella.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What for? It’s not going to rain.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know that, but with skin as fair as mine, moon burn is a real possibility.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s a bazinga, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One of my best, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, do you want to double-check the equatorial mount on the laser? We need it locked onto the Sea of Tranquility.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You got it. Oh, Raj, no. Billions of dollars have gone into inventing the Internet and filling it with pictures of naked women, so we don’t have to peep through windows.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s not like that, I’m watching someone’s TV. The Good Wife is on. I tell you, this is my new Grey’s Anatomy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, Leonard. What is that? What is that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Relax, it’s just a dirty sock.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How on earth can you say dirty sock and relax in the same sentence?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, the world is filled with dirty discarded socks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not my world.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you know who’d really dig seeing this experiment? Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wasn’t aware that lunar ranging was her thing. Although, I suppose the retro-reflector left on the moon by Neil Armstrong does qualify as a shiny object.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why don’t you ask her to come up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, it’s still a little weird since, you know…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She dumped you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She didn’t dump me. We were just in different places in the relationship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I fail to see how a relationship can have the qualities of a geographic location.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, it’s very simple. Leonard was living in a little town called please don’t leave me, while Penny had just moved to the island of bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Screw you guys. I’m gonna go see if she’s home.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If it’s not too much trouble, I’d like to point this at the moon now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait a second, the good wife is crying. Something’s very wrong.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hi. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re up on the roof bouncing laser beams off the moon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s pretty cool. We’ve got a two-meter parabolic reflector and everything. I thought you might want to see it.

utterance.speaker: Man in Penny’s Apartment
utterance.content: That makes no sense.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: How can you bounce stuff off the moon? There’s no gravity.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, Leonard, this is Zack. Zack, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, sorry, I didn’t know you were busy. Maybe another time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey, I want to see this laser thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, but what about the party?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: It’s a surprise party, doesn’t matter when we get there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, yeah, come on up. So, how’d you two guys meet?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: My company designs the menus for the Cheesecake Factory.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Your company?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Well,, my dad, but me and my sister are VPs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, menus.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I know it sounds easy but there’s a lot of science that goes in designing them.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Happy now? I’m moving the dirty sock.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Raj, keep an eye out for the other one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, guys, this is my friend Zack.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Whoa! Is that the laser? It’s bitchin’.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. In 1917, when Albert Einstein established the theoretic foundation for the laser in his paper Zur Quantentheorie der Strahlung, his fondest hope was that the resultant device be bitchin’.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Well, mission accomplished.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let me explain what we’re doing here. Um, in 1969, the astronauts on Apollo 11 positioned reflectors on the surface of the moon, and we’re going to shoot a laser off one of them and let the light bounce back into this photomultiplier.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh! That’s very cool.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: One question. How can you be sure it won’t blow up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The laser?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: The moon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See, now this is a man for Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, that’s a great question, Zack.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s not.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon! Play nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well it’s not a great question. How could somebody possibly think we’re going to blow up the moon? That’s a great question.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t worry about the moon. We, we set our laser to stun.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Smart.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now, we’ll be able to see the beam when it leaves, but it won’t be strong enough when it comes back to be seen by the naked eye.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Naked.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. Uh yeah, funny. Uh, that device there will measure the photons that return and let us see it on this computer. Raj, get them some glasses.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Cool, it’s gonna be in 3-D?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Preparing to fire laser at the moon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Make it so.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There it is. There’s the spike!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: 2.5 seconds for the light to return. That’s the moon! We hit the moon!

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: That’s your big experiment? All that for a line on the screen?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but, uh, think about what this represents. The fact that we can do this is the only way of definitively proving that there are man-made objects on the moon, put there by a member of a species that only 60 years before had just invented the airplane.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: What species is that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was wrong. Penny can do better.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, guys, thank you, it’s been fun.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks. Should we invite them to the party?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, just keep walking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He must be very skilled at coitus.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m telling you, dude, the only way to feel better about Penny going out with other guys is for you to get back on the whores.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Horse.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The phrase is get back on the horse, not whores.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s disgusting, dude.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, it’s not… Never mind. He is right, though. If you want, I can turn you on to this great new dating site I found.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You sure? They say they can find a match for anybody.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Have they found a match for you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tons. I’ve had, like, eight dates in the last month. And twelve if you count the ones who showed up and left.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t bring the nitrogen tank down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, let me restate that. It’s very heavy, and I don’t want to.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll help you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Lift with your knees, not your back. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know what would be fun? Signing Sheldon up for online dating.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, think about it. We make it an experiment. Like when Frankenstein’s monster was lonely and he found a wife.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He didn’t find a wife. They built him a wife out of dead body parts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, we’ll call that plan B.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Coming!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Damn you, you rat bastard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you drunk?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Zack was a perfectly nice guy, and then you ruined him!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How did I ruin him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: ‘Cause in the olden days, I never would’ve known he was so stupid.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, he wasn’t that stupid.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, he was! He thought you were gonna blow up the moon!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, yeah, he’s stupid.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He spent the entire night bragging about how he invented the word appe-teasers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How is that my fault?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You have destroyed my ability to tolerate idiots. Now, come with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re gonna have sex.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why? I mean, okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Put on your noise-cancelling headphones, ’cause it’s gonna get loud.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh! Not this again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In what universe is this low-pulp? Good morning, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What, do you have eyes in the back of your head?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When one gets beaten up every other day in school, one of necessity develops a keen sense of hearing. Incidentally, one can get beaten up in school simply by referring to oneself as one. I’m making English muffins. Would you like an English muffin?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, I’m not hungry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: FYI, my noise-cancelling headphones proved ineffective last night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As a native Texan, I must say I’ve never heard the phrase yee-haw used in quite that context.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, God. That I’ve heard on multiple occasions. In what universe is that lightly toasted? This has to be the worst day of my life. Good morning, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How many times have I asked you not to do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Counting this instance? 317.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where’s Penny?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She returned to her apartment. I presume to shower and vomit. Not necessarily in that order.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wonder why she didn’t say good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you expecting me to offer an explanation of human behaviour?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. I just thought as an outsider, you might be able to provide a fresh perspective.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have no difficulty believing you’re not butter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hi. Um, I gotta run. Early shift.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll walk down with you. So, last night was fun, huh?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it must have been. I just threw up in my closet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bummer. Anyway, I was thinking tonight maybe we could catch a movie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, tonight’s not great for me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Doesn’t have to be tonight. I’m free pretty much always.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, last night was a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When you say mistake, do you mean a fortunate mistake, like the discovery of penicillin?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, I’m sorry. I was drunk, I was lonely, I hated Zack. Can we just forget it ever happened?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s pretty well imprinted on my brain. Especially the whole rodeo thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, that’s it? Wham, bam, thank you, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, I said I’m sorry. Can’t u please let it go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How am I supposed to let it go? You used me for sex! Morning, Mrs. Gunderson.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Gunderson
utterance.content: Good morning, Leonard. Or should I say yee-haw?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Holy crap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We finally have proof that aliens walk among us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The dating site matched a woman with Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re kidding. An actual woman?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, look. Breasts and everything.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Trust me, breasts doesn’t necessarily mean woman.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll show you a picture of my Uncle Louie in a bathing suit sometime. Leonard, you gotta see this, we found a match for Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. Maybe she can have sex with him, and then walk out on him the next morning without so much as a how do you do?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you know what he’s talking about?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nope. Why don’t you ask him?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Leonard, what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t want to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That was a lousy suggestion.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whatever. Right now, Dr. Sheldon Cooper has to send an e-mail to his perfect match. Greetings, fellow life-form…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If she can do it, I can do it. If she can do it, I can do it. If she can do it, I can do it. I can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Leslie Winkle
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hi. Hey. Hi, Leslie.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Leonard Hofstadter. What’re you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I know! It’s been a while!

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Yeah, 18 months.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. Right. So how you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Fine. You?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, not bad. You remember when we used to have sex and you said that it didn’t mean anything, it was just for fun?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, do you, uh, want to do that again?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: What happened? Blondie dumped you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She didn’t dump me. We were just in different places in the relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, anyway, apparently, it’s okay to go back to people you’re no longer seeing and have recreational sex with them.

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, what do you say?

utterance.speaker: Leslie
utterance.content: Let me think about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She’s not coming back.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh-oh. She wants to meet us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not us. Him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, but him doesn’t even know about her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, him about to find out about her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? Us gonna tell him?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who’s going to tell whom about what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your surprise confuses me. I live here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Right. So, listen, what are you doing tomorrow afternoon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Be more specific.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Four thirty.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not afternoon. That’s preevning.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a time of day I invented. It better defines the ambiguous period between afternoon and evening. Preevning. I’m fairly certain it will catch on as it fills a desperate need.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Right, okay. What are you doing tomorrow preevning?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, tomorrow’s Saturday. Saturday night is laundry night, so I’ll be spending the preevning pre-sorting and pre-soaking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, what if I were to tell you, tomorrow, at 4:30 you could meet a woman who has been scientifically chosen to be your perfect mate?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I would snort in derision and throw my arms in the air, exhausted by your constant tomfoolery.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But it’s true. But we-we put all your vital information into this dating site, answered all their questions just like you would, and they found a match for you. Her name is Amy Farrah Fowler.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please. Even assuming you could answer any question the way I would, the algorithms used by matchmaking sites are complete hokum.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And that’s exactly the answer we gave to the question, what is your attitude towards online dating”

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard wanted to write mumbo jumbo, but I said no, our Sheldon would say hokum.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, come on, where’s your scientific curiosity?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, most of it is being applied to unravelling the secrets of the universe while the rest of it’s wondering why I’m having this conversation with you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, how about this. Even Spock had a date once every seven years.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He didn’t date. It was pon farr. His blood boiled with mating lust.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, well, why don’t you start with a cup of coffee, and you can pon farr Amy Farrah Fowler later.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t drink coffee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, you can have a hot chocolate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As I will not be engaging in this nonsense, my choice of beverage is moot. But for the record, I only drink hot chocolate in months with an R in them.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s life without whimsy?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’ve hidden the dirty sock from the roof somewhere in your apartment. Unless you are willing to come with us to meet this girl, it will remain there forever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re bluffing.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you willing to risk it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Curse you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thirty feet.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Hey, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was a perfectly happy, geeky, little lonely guy, and you ruined me!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you drunk?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on. We’re gonna have sex, and it’s not gonna mean a thing!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you out of your mind?!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m really starting to think there’s a double standard here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In a few minutes, when I gloat over the failure of this enterprise, how would you prefer I do it? The standard I told you so? The classic neener-neener? Or just my normal look of haughty derision?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You don’t know we’re wrong yet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Haughty derision it is.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Excuse me. I’m Amy Farrah Fowler. You’re Sheldon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, Amy Farrah Fowler. I’m sorry to inform you that you have been taken in by unsupportable mathematics designed to prey on the gullible and the lonely. Additionally, I’m being blackmailed with a hidden dirty sock.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If that was slang, I’m unfamiliar with it. If it was literal, I share your aversion to soiled hosiery. In any case, I’m here because my mother and I have agreed that I will date at least once a year.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. My mother and I have the same agreement about church.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t object to the concept of a deity, but I’m baffled by the notion of one that takes attendance.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then you might want to avoid East Texas.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Noted. Now, before this goes any further, you should know that all forms of physical contact up to and including coitus are off the table.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: May I buy you a beverage?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Tepid water, please.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good God, what have we done?
